title: Kids turn lives around through theatre
text:
Kids turn lives around through theatre 
Thursday 15 Oct 2015 6:42 p.m. 
By Sarah Stewart 
Jumping on stage to perform can be daunting for anyone. But for these kids, it's a big deal. 
It is not just because it is opening night but because of their background and where they have come from. 
Some were in gang families, while others got involved with the wrong crowds â€“ and for these children, the creative arts organisation Nga Rangatahi Toa has given them hope. 
Anika Moa has been one of the mentors helping the kids use music to face their past. 
Everyone in the programme has gone back to school, into tertiary study or gets a job. 
Story went to see these kids who are proof that you can always change your path.
